main event: On 11 July 1949 at 2110 hours, a military observer at Camp Hood, Texas, saw a unidentified aerial object streaking through the sky. The object was twice as large as a shooting star and appeared to follow a straight path before disappearing fast, as if turning off a light.
interesting points: The object was pale red in color and had the shape of a ball but not a perfect circle.
It was observed at an altitude of approximately 4000 ft above the tree line and was twice as large as the evening star.
The observer estimated its speed, with the object covering a given angular distance in just 2 seconds.
No sound, odor, or trail was associated with the object, and it did not affect the clouds or exhibit any projections or maneuvers.
The observer was a military sergeant stationed at Camp Hood and was noted to have average intelligence.
sighted object: unidentified aerial object streaking through the sky
